metadata.source: Elson Financial AI - Financial Literacy Foundation
metadata.description: Financial literacy fundamentals for users at all wealth levels, from $0 to building first savings

step_1.title: Know Your Numbers
step_1.description: Understanding where you stand is the foundation of all financial progress
actions: List all sources of income (job, side gigs, benefits)
List all monthly expenses (rent, utilities, food, transportation)
List all debts (credit cards, loans, amounts owed)
Calculate: Income minus Expenses = What you have to work with

step_2.title: Open a Bank Account
step_2.description: Having a safe place for your money is essential
what_to_look_for: No monthly fees (or easy ways to avoid them)

step_3.title: Track Every Dollar
step_3.description: You can't improve what you don't measure

zero_based_budget.description: Every dollar has a job (income minus expenses equals zero)
process: Assign every dollar to a category
Adjust until income minus expenses equals zero

envelope_system.description: Cash in physical or digital envelopes for each category
process: Create envelope for each spending category
Put budgeted cash amount in each
When envelope is empty, stop spending in that category
Automate transfer to savings on payday

budgeting_tips: Be realistic - don't cut everything fun
Build in buffer for unexpected expenses

what_is_it.description: Money set aside for unexpected expenses or income loss
what_is_it.purpose: Financial safety net to avoid debt when emergencies happen

cutting_back: Eat out one less time per week

no: Routine expenses you forgot to budget

good_debt.description: Debt that can increase net worth or income
good_debt.note: Still needs to be managed responsibly

bad_debt.description: High-interest debt for depreciating assets or consumption
bad_debt.priority: Pay off as quickly as possible

debt_avalanche.method: Pay minimums on all, extra money to highest interest rate debt
cons: May take longer to see progress

debt_snowball.method: Pay minimums on all, extra money to smallest balance debt
debt_snowball.best_for: Those who need motivation from progress

debt_consolidation.description: Combine multiple debts into one payment
options: Balance transfer credit card (0% intro APR)
debt_consolidation.caution: Don't rack up new debt after consolidating

getting_out_of_debt_steps: Stop adding new debt (cut up cards if needed)
List all debts with balance, rate, and minimum payment
Find extra money to throw at debt

how_interest_works.apr: Annual Percentage Rate - yearly cost of borrowing
how_interest_works.calculation: If you carry a balance, interest is charged on average daily balance
how_interest_works.grace_period: Pay full balance by due date = no interest charges

key_rules: Pay full balance every month if possible
Never pay just the minimum (interest trap)
Don't close old cards (hurts credit history)

payment_history_35_percent.description: Most important - do you pay on time?
payment_history_35_percent.improve: Always pay at least minimum by due date

amounts_owed_30_percent.description: How much of available credit are you using?
amounts_owed_30_percent.improve: Keep credit card balances under 30% of limit (under 10% is ideal)

length_of_history_15_percent.description: How long have you had credit?
length_of_history_15_percent.improve: Keep old accounts open, be patient

credit_mix_10_percent.description: Variety of credit types (cards, loans, mortgage)
credit_mix_10_percent.improve: Don't open accounts just for mix - it develops naturally

new_credit_10_percent.improve: Don't apply for many accounts at once

options.description: Deposit equals credit limit, easy approval
options.tip: Use for small purchases, pay in full monthly

options.description: Bank holds money while you make payments, released at end
Be added to someone else's card (with good history)
options.tip: Their good history helps your score
Watch out for high interest rates

monitoring.free_reports: AnnualCreditReport.com - free weekly from all 3 bureaus
monitoring.free_scores: Many banks and cards provide free scores
monitoring.check_regularly: At least once per year, ideally quarterly

start_early_why.compound_interest: Your money earns money, then that earns money

mutual_funds.description: Pool of many stocks and/or bonds, professionally managed

etfs.description: Like mutual funds but trade like stocks

401k_403b.employer_match: Free money - always contribute enough to get full match

ira.description: Individual Retirement Account - you open it yourself

types.traditional: Tax deduction now, taxed in retirement
types.roth: No deduction now, tax-free in retirement

ira.which_to_choose: Roth if you expect higher taxes in retirement; Traditional if you need deduction now

why_insurance.purpose: Transfer risk of major financial losses
why_insurance.principle: Pay small amount (premium) to avoid potentially huge loss

health_insurance.importance: Critical - medical debt is leading cause of bankruptcy

key_terms.deductible: Amount you pay before insurance kicks in
key_terms.out_of_pocket_max: Most you pay in a year

auto_insurance.importance: Required by law in most states
coverage_types: Collision (damage to your car from accident)

life_insurance.who_needs_it: Those with dependents relying on their income

types.term: Coverage for set period (10, 20, 30 years) - most affordable
types.whole: Permanent coverage with cash value - more expensive

mindset_shifts.to: I'm building my financial future one step at a time

mindset_shifts.from: I deserve to spend on myself
mindset_shifts.to: I deserve financial security and peace of mind
Wealth is built through consistent habits over time
I'll spend what's left after saving

milestone_3.impact: Money working for you instead of against

habits_of_wealth_builders: Surround yourself with financially responsible people

mistakes_to_avoid.consequence: Forced into debt for any unexpected expense

mistakes_to_avoid.mistake: Paying only minimum on credit cards
mistakes_to_avoid.consequence: Interest compounds, debt takes decades to pay
mistakes_to_avoid.fix: Pay as much as possible, focus on one card at a time

mistakes_to_avoid.consequence: Money disappears without progress toward goals
mistakes_to_avoid.fix: Start with simple budget, track spending

mistakes_to_avoid.consequence: Raises don't translate to wealth building
mistakes_to_avoid.fix: Save at least 50% of every raise

mistakes_to_avoid.consequence: Leaving free money on the table
mistakes_to_avoid.fix: Always contribute enough to get full match
Buy reliable used car, avoid payments if possible

books_for_beginners.title: I Will Teach You to Be Rich
books_for_beginners.author: Ramit Sethi
